name: Supporting 2SLGBTQ+ Colleagues at Work
description: Equity, diversity and inclusion work is a learning journey for everyone. Where some may be comfortable showing support for their 2SLGBTQ+ colleagues others might not know where to begin. This pathway will help you to understand the diverse range of identities that make up the 2SLGBTQ+ community, while providing you with the tools to ensure your interactions with your coworkers are inclusive and respectful.
objective: Deepen your understanding of the spectrum of gender and sexual identities within the 2SLGBTQ+ community and learn how to create a safe workplace where all people can bring their full selves to work. (More steps and resources to come!)

steps.name: Engaging with Community
steps.description: Build an awareness of the resources, communities and organizations that support the creation of inclusive work environments that honour the contributions of 2SLGBTQ+ colleagues.

activities.name: Pride at Work Canada
activities.description:
This organization supports private, public and nonprofit employers to create safer, more inclusive workplaces that recognize the skills of 2SLGBTQ+ people. Pride at Work Canada holds learning, networking and community events across the country where they provide advice, celebrate and connect the most inclusive Canadian employers.

Visit the site for articles and the Queering the Future of Work presentation recording.

activity_type.name: Read
activity_type.description: From real paper books to study abstracts and blog posts; the classic written word enhancing your learning in many ways.

activities.name: QMUNITY: BC’s Queer, Trans, and Two-Spirit Resource Centre
activities.description: QMUNITY is a non-profit organization in BC that works to improve queer, trans and Two-Spirit lives through services, connection and leadership. Learn more about QMUNITY and explore its many resources.

activity_type.name: Read
activity_type.description: From real paper books to study abstracts and blog posts; the classic written word enhancing your learning in many ways.

activities.name: 2SLGBTQ+ Community Members: Consider joining the 2SLGBTQIA+ ERG
activities.description: The Two-Spirit, Queer and/or Trans (2SQT+) Network is for BC Public Service employees who identify as lesbian, gay, bisexual, transgender, queer, intersex, asexual and/or Two-Spirit (2SLGBTQIA+). This includes those who identify as part of the 2SLGBTQIA+ community and use different terms or concepts to refer to their sexual orientation, gender identity or gender expression. This community space allows employees to connect and build a supportive network. Please visit the Compass site to learn more about employee resource groups and how to join.

activity_type.name: Participate
activity_type.description: Activities that require your interactaction, either in person courses, or via elearning, quizzes, or surveys that provide measurable feedback.

steps.name: Supporting Transgender and Gender Diverse Colleagues
steps.description: Recognize the difference between sexual orientation, gender identity and gender expression and understand what changes your workplace needs to make to become inclusive of transgender and gender diverse colleagues.

activities.name: Creating a Trans-Inclusive Workplace
activities.description:
Learn about research involving more than 1,000 transgender people over six years. This research reveals four key areas of intervention that can cultivate a more transgender-inclusive workplace:

1. Basic signs of transgender inclusivity involving bathroom use, dress codes, and pronouns

2. Effective support for gender transitions

3. Transgender-specific diversity trainings

4. Interventions to build resiliency

activity_type.name: Read
activity_type.description: From real paper books to study abstracts and blog posts; the classic written word enhancing your learning in many ways.

activities.name: Supporting Transgender and Gender Diverse Employees in the Workplace
activities.description: This resource, customized for the BC Public Service, was developed to support employees and managers in enhancing their knowledge regarding supporting transgender and gender diverse people in the workplace.

activity_type.name: Read
activity_type.description: From real paper books to study abstracts and blog posts; the classic written word enhancing your learning in many ways.

activities.name: Guide to Being a Trans Ally
activities.description:
This guide is part of PFLAG Nationals (US) Straight for Equality program. It is an easy to read and informative guide to being a trans ally that covers:

  • Definitions
  • Transitioning
  • Allyship and the ally spectrum
  • Barriers
  • Pronouns
  • Five positive ways to be a trans ally (see p. 45)
  • A glossary of terms.

activity_type.name: Read
activity_type.description: From real paper books to study abstracts and blog posts; the classic written word enhancing your learning in many ways.

activities.name: No Big Deal Campaign Canada
activities.description: This resource offers tools to help support transgender and non-binary people and their pronouns in everyday life. Read about the campaign, watch an explainer video on the importance of recognizing pronouns or share one of the free graphics on your social media to show your support.

activity_type.name: Participate

topic.name: Build an Inclusive Workplace
topic.description: It’s up to each and every one of us to create work environments in which employees feel and are involved, respected, valued and connected.

categories.name: Equity, Diversity and Inclusion
categories.description:
Wondering how you can improve your workplace culture? Interested in building your toolbox to help combat discrimination and ensure a healthy workplace for all your coworkers? No matter your current level of skill, as an equity, diversity and inclusion champion you’ll find an activity here that will help you develop your confidence in creating change in your workplace.

Pathways are made up of a collection of external resources, content may change over time. If you find a broken link or inaccurate content, use the "Report" button.
